title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Modi-Putin: Manufacturing, pharma & tech ties
items.summary:
- **Pharmaceuticals** cooperation: joint vaccine development, health care, cancer therapies, radiopharmaceuticals and API supply chains, with potential ties in fertilisers, textiles and electronics to accelerate the $100B trade goal. 
- Advanced tech collaboration: progress in **digitalisation**, autonomous robotics and high‑tech medical equipment, underpinned by *co‑innovation* and *co‑creation*. 
- Workforce and training: Modi cited India's growing skilled workforce and urged training youth in Russian language and soft skills to create a **Russia-ready workforce** and strengthen manufacturing ties.

items.title: Fineotex acquires CrudeChem Technologies Group
items.summary:
- Fineotex Chemical acquires CrudeChem Technologies Group to expand into *North America*.
- The acquisition gives access to a *$11.5 billion North American market* across midstream, refining and water treatment.
- Management plans to build a *$200 million oil field chemical business* and a global platform focused on innovation and **environmental responsibility**.

items.title: Bengal to launch 660 MW Sagardighi unit on Dec 10
items.author: Dwaipayan Ghosh
items.summary:
- The *660 MW Sagardighi* supercritical unit, built by *WBPDCL*, will start operations from **Dec 10**.
- This would be **Bengal's largest** and **NE India's first** supercritical power plant, built at over ₹4,567 crore and expected to supply power to about *16.7 lakh families*.
- The project is expected to create around **26,000 jobs** and significantly boost Bengal's generation capacity from about **6,000 MW**.

items.title: Modi, Putin expand India–Russia cooperation with 2030 agenda covering energy, transport links, critical minerals
SKF India (Industrial) lists on bourses after demerger; plans ₹800–950 crore capex through 2030
Lupin gets USFDA nod for multiple sclerosis drug
BEML wins ₹157 crore order to manufacture switch rail grinding machines
BEML, Sagarmala Finance Corp ink pact to boost country's maritime manufacturing sector
Cyient IP for ₹4,500-cr SCL upgrade
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Cyient Semiconductors has been technically qualified to supply and validate IP for the ₹4,500-crore SCL modernisation in Mohali under **ISM**.*
- *The programme expands domestic chip-making capacity, reduces import reliance, and opens **fabrication facilities** to startups, academia, and strategic sectors.*
- *Cyient will supply and qualify three foundational technologies—**RF-CMOS**, **BCD (HV LDMOS)**, and **CIS**—for SCL’s upgraded 8-inch fab.*

items.title: PTC arm inks Honeywell titanium castings pact
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Under the agreement, Aerolloy Technologies will produce *titanium* and *superalloy* precision investment castings through a vertically integrated process at its Uttar Pradesh facility for Honeywell Aerospace.
- The deal covers *aero-engine components*, enhances *traceability*, and provides long-term reliability and multi-year revenue visibility for global OEMs.
- PTC Industries chairman Sachin Agarwal says the collaboration reinforces India's position in the global aerospace supply chain and showcases ATL's capabilities.

items.title: Waaree Solar Americas wins 288 MW module supply order from US-based firm
India's renewable energy shift: States, C&I sector, and rooftop solar drive future growth
Australia eyes deeper India ties through critical minerals cooperation
India, Russia eye trade boost with more diversified basket
Karnataka eyes $150B electronics investment
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary: - Industries Minister *M B Patil* directed officials to draft a policy to boost mobile and electronics manufacturing, aiming for about *$150 billion* in investments. - Patil met delegations led by *Pankaj Mohindroo* of *ICEA* to discuss Karnataka’s approach and parallel schemes with the Centre. - Mohindroo noted the Union scheme prioritises displays/camera modules and offers incentives while Karnataka studies feasibility for alignment with other states.

items.title: Iveco Defence Orders Rise on EU SAFE Plan
items.summary:
- *Iveco Defence Vehicles* sees a near-term order uptick driven by the EU's *SAFE* plan, with production needing to accelerate.
- IDV is expanding capacity in Bolzano and Piacenza and setting up a propulsion engines division in Turin, tied to a deal with **Leonardo** valued at **€1.7 billion** for completion in **Q1 2026**.
- The EU *SAFE* scheme aims to boost bloc defence capabilities, prompting suppliers to scale up and better serve European allies.

items.title: Suzlon unveils plan for 3 new AI-enabled smart blade units
Andhra Pradesh to get India's 1st 6 GW ingot-wafer plant
items.author: Nidhi Sharma, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- India will get its first integrated 6 GW ingot-wafer solar plant in *Anakapalli*, Andhra Pradesh by *ReNew Photovoltaics*.
- The *₹3,990 crore* project is backed by the central *PLI* scheme and aims to cut reliance on Chinese imports while boosting **300 GW** by 2030.
- The plant will span ~130–140 acres, with completion expected by March 2026 and commercial production by January 2028.

items.title: India seeks stronger Russia backing for indigenous defence tech
RBI lifts FY26 GDP growth forecast to 7.3% on strong domestic demand
RBI cuts FY26 inflation forecast to 2% as food prices ease
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- RBI trims FY26 CPI inflation forecast to 2%, down from 2.6%, led by a sharper fall in food prices.
- Governor Sanjay Malhotra says the decline is now more generalised, aided by better food supply, reservoir levels and favourable weather, with core inflation easing.
- RBI projects 2.6% in Q3 and 2.9% in Q4 this year, with 3.9–4% in Q1–Q2 next year, while risks are evenly balanced.

items.title: RBI MPC cuts repo rate to 5.25%, keeps neutral stance
items.summary:
- The MPC cut the *repo rate by 25 bps to 5.25%* as inflation cools and there is room to *support growth*, while keeping a *neutral stance*.
- Governor *Sanjay Malhotra* noted disinflation and that headline/core inflation may hover around 4% in H1 next year within the 2–6% band.
- To ensure liquidity, RBI announced open market purchases of government securities worth ₹1 lakh crore and a three-year $5B swap, signaling continued policy support.

items.title: Raymond Group appoints Rakesh Tiwary as Group CFO
items.summary: - Rakesh Tiwary is appointed **Group CFO** of the *Raymond Group*, effective **Dec 3, 2025**.\n- He brings over 25 years of *financial leadership* across cement, airports, electricity, solar, steel, oil and infrastructure.\n- The move aligns with Raymond's three-entity restructuring to deepen financial discipline and unlock *shareholder value*.

items.title: Corning exec Andrew Beck says everyone’s eyes are on India market
Tata, Cyient, Applied Materials units emerge as L1 bidders for SCL fab upgrade
From 2 hours to 10 minutes: Inside Apollo Tyres’ AI revolution
Intel says it will keep networking and communications unit
items.summary:
- Intel will keep its NEX networking and communications unit in-house after a strategic review, saying tighter integration between silicon, software and systems will boost offerings in *AI*, *data center*, and *edge*.
- The decision follows Intel weighing asset sales; the company has improved its cash position after an **$8.9B** U.S. government investment for a 10% stake and **$2B** from SoftBank plus **$5B** from Nvidia.
- Earlier this year Reuters reported Intel explored spinning out NEX as part of CEO *Lip-Bu Tan*'s plan to shave off non-core businesses.

items.title: Trump praises Nvidia CEO after export-controls talk
items.summary:
- *Trump* praised Nvidia CEO *Jensen Huang* after a meeting on *export controls*, calling him a 'smart man'.
- Nvidia's *H200 chips* to China are under consideration as the administration weighs export licenses and Nvidia faces bills aimed at US-first sales.
- Huang downplayed smuggling concerns at a CSIS event, noting GPUs are large and complex, with one on display 'weighing two tons'.

items.title: Hikvision challenges US crackdown on Chinese gear
items.summary:
- Hikvision filed a petition for *judicial review* challenging the **FCC** decision, saying it exceeds authority and retroactively curtails lawful authorizations.
- The **Covered List** blocked new imports and erases previously approved equipment amid a broader security crackdown by the FCC.
- The dispute highlights a tense clash over **national security** and regulatory predictability, potentially affecting Hikvision's customers and partners.

items.title: Taiwan to train US chip workforce amid talks
items.summary:
- Taiwan will help train American workers for *advanced semiconductor production*, as U.S.–Taiwan talks near completion.
- *TSMC* has pledged about $100B more in the U.S., bringing total to around $160.5B, while *Micron* and *Texas Instruments* expand domestic projects, totaling roughly *$300B* in semiconductor investments.
- Taiwan’s negotiators say there is no commitment to train U.S. personnel in the talks, focusing on tariff treatment, with a likely tariff reduction but MFN rates not to be stacked.

items.title: Cybersecurity product revenues to reach $6B by 2026: DSCI
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- *DSCI* projects India's cybersecurity product revenues to reach about **$6 billion** by 2026.
- The sector grew 4x in the last 5 years and **25%** YoY in 2025, with new geographies including the *Middle East*.
- There are over 400 Indian cybersecurity product companies; **AI** and the *Digital Personal Data Protection Act* compliance will be key growth drivers.

items.title: UMC, Polar to explore US 8-inch wafer production
items.author: Wen-Yee Lee
items.summary:
- *UMC* and *Polar Semiconductor* signed an MoU to explore US production of *8-inch wafers* at Polar's expanded *Minnesota fab*. 
- The partnership combines Polar's US manufacturing capabilities with *UMC*'s 8-inch technology portfolio and global customer base to support multi-sourcing and domestic supply. 
- The move aims to strengthen *US manufacturing* and boost *supply-chain resilience* amid shifting geopolitics.

items.title: Alligator Automations opens ₹40 cr unit in Pune
items.summary:
- **₹40 crore** investment fuels a Pune unit that could triple production capacity.
- The plant includes fabrication lines, a powder-coating facility, automated storage for over 100 tonnes, and a **100,000 sq ft** assembly area to handle 15–20 large projects at once.
- It aims to reduce delivery times by **20%** and raise exports by **30%**, strengthening India’s manufacturing ecosystem.

items.title: Tsugami opens ₹300cr plant in Chennai
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Tsugami* inaugurated a 300,000 sq ft assembly plant and foundry in *Oragadam, Chennai*, its first Indian foundry and the largest Japanese investment in the country. 
- The facility has an annual assembly capacity of 3,000 machines and a 6,000-tonne foundry capacity, with about 700 direct jobs and 300 through the ecosystem. 
- The project underscores long-term *Japan–India industrial ties*, blending *Japanese technology* with *Tamil Nadu's workforce* to boost domestic production and supplier links.

items.title: AI as a partner in process: Human-centric automation in logistics
India could meet 28% of demand with next-gen nuclear by 2050
items.summary:
- *A Bayesian Energy study* suggests India could meet up to *28%* of its electricity demand by 2050 with next‑gen nuclear technologies.
- The model finds that combining advanced nuclear with renewables could cut total system costs by *10–21%* versus a renewables‑only approach.
- It projects *168–328 GW* of nuclear capacity by mid‑century, supplying *13–28%* of electricity with SMRs helping grid stability and low‑carbon power for industry.

items.title: Govt rejects Bloomberg claim of new $2B submarine deal
items.summary:
- The government described Bloomberg's claim of a fresh $2B submarine deal as *misleading*, noting no new agreement has been signed and the lease comes from a 2019 contract with delivery now set for 2028.
- PIB clarified the submarine lease originates from the 2019 contract, with its delayed delivery rescheduled to 2028.
- The piece also highlights growing India–Russia trade momentum, with officials citing a target of **$100 billion** in two‑way trade by 2030 and steps to boost imports from India.

items.title: India targets autos-to-electronics exports to Russia
items.summary:
- India aims to widen exports to *Russia* and push autos and electronics, with *Putin* arriving for a state visit.
- New Delhi is addressing a $59B trade deficit by flagging over 65 non-tariff barriers on marine exports and outlining pharma barriers.
- The India-Russia dialogue expects 10 inter-governmental agreements and 15 commercial deals, signaling broader cooperation.

items.title: India-Russia tango: Putin means business, and more
Ahead of FY27 budget: seamless tube manufacturers seek sops
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- STMAI urges the government to extend a *Production-Linked Incentive (PLI)* scheme covering at least *10% of exports* of seamless pipes.
- India exported 172,000 tonnes of seamless pipes worth USD 606 million in 2023, underscoring the sector's *export potential*.
- STMAI President Shiv Kumar Singhal called for raising the *customs duty* on illegal imports from 10% to 20% to shield domestic producers.

items.title: Kavveri develops indigenous antenna for defence drones
items.summary:
- Kavveri Defence & Wireless Technologies has developed an *indigenous* dual-polarised, high-gain antenna for *drone platforms* used by the *Indian Armed Forces*. 
- The system was designed in-house and delivered under an emergency procurement, chosen over a North American supplier to boost *domestic defence communications*. 
- MD Shivakumar Reddy says the project strengthens *in-house capabilities* and India’s wireless defence technology base.

items.title: India clinches $2 billion Russia submarine deal as Putin visits
Fitch raises India's FY26 GDP forecast to 7.4%
items.summary:
- Fitch raises India's FY26 GDP growth forecast to **7.4%**, citing stronger *consumer spending* and **GST reforms**, with Q2 growth at **8.2%**. 
- Falling inflation gives the *RBI* room for one more **5.25%** policy rate cut in December, after **100 bps** of cuts in 2025. 
- Growth is expected to ease later in FY26, while private investment is likely to pick up in 2026-27 and inflation remains subdued.

items.title: Novo Nordisk gears up for Ozempic launch in India
items.summary:
- *Ozempic* will hit the Indian market within weeks as Novo Nordisk expands its semaglutide portfolio in a *price-sensitive* market. 
- The launch follows regulatory clearance and faces competition from Wegovy, generics, and Eli Lilly's *Mounjaro*, with Indian firms developing semaglutide versions. 
- Analysts say Ozempic's India entry could strengthen Novo's diabetes/obesity franchise, but long-term pricing will depend on generic access.

items.title: Opening up nuclear power sector to private firms
items.author: Shilpa Samant, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Amendments* to the Atomic Energy Act and CLND Act will permit private firms and states to operate nuclear plants, targeting **100 GW by 2047**. 
- *Private investment* and *SMRs* are key for a ten‑fold capacity rise, with clearer liability and arbitration rules. 
- A mix of *large reactors* and *SMRs* with improved logistics aims for long‑term, low‑emission growth in India's energy map.
keywords: Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act

items.title: NHPC synchronises first unit of 2,000-MW Subansiri Lower hydel project
PLI scheme drives 43k jobs in solar module manufacturing
items.author: G Balachandar
items.summary:
- India’s solar PV module PLI scheme has generated about **43,000** jobs across nine states by October 2025, led by **Gujarat**.
- Gujarat accounts for over 22,400 jobs in large projects, with Tamil Nadu second at about 6,800, led by major players like **Reliance Industries** and **Adani**.
- Policy levers such as **ALMM** and the PLI, plus import duties, are expected to push domestic capacity beyond **165 GW** by 2027.

items.title: JSW–JFE to form 50:50 JV for BPSL unit
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- *JSW Steel* to form a 50:50 JV with **JFE Steel Corporation** by transferring Bhushan Power and Steel’s (BPSL) steel business into a new entity for ₹24,483 crore.
- *JFE* will invest ₹15,750 crore in two tranches to acquire half of the JV, which will be held via **JSW Kalinga Steel Limited** and **JSW Sambalpur Steel Limited** through a slump sale.
- The deal awaits **approvals**, monetises BPSL assets, and targets expansion toward about **50 mtpa** capacity by FY31.

items.title: JSW Steel to merge Piombino Steel for direct BPSL control
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- **JSW Steel** will merge Piombino Steel Limited (**PSL**), the holding company of Bhushan Power and Steel Limited (**BPSL**), into itself from Jan 1, 2026, and PSL will cease to exist. 
- PSL currently holds 100% of **BPSL** and is 82.65% owned by **JSW Steel** and 17.35% by **JSW Shipping & Logistics**; the merger will give JSW direct ownership, reduce corporate layers, and free cash for expansion. 
- The scheme requires approvals from the **NCLT**, shareholders, creditors, stock exchanges and **SEBI**.

items.title: A320 quality row: Airbus trims 2025 delivery target to 790 jets
